result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Justin Singleton in court.   Defendant Clyne M Stanley did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into 15CM305.
voir dire questions filed by Attorney Singleton
for theory of defense jury instruction.
filed by the defense

Cases 15CM1107 and 15CM305 called.  Defendant Clyne M Stanley in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Singleton advises this case will go to trial.  Parties are prepared to go to trial on both 15CM1107 and 15CM305.  Court advises case # 15CM305 will go to trial first.  If the witnesses do not appear on case # 15CM305, the court will hear 15CM1107 at trial.  Parties have until 1/11/2016, Noon, to submit questions for voir dire.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
